intro: Zeugites pittieri var. pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's zeugite, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or riverine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
